questions.question_text: Which device is used to connect to the H.323 gatekeeper?

comments.content: What is your reason for answer D?

discussion.content: H.225 trunk gatekeeper-controlled Use an H.225 gatekeeper-controlled trunk for toll bypass or for integration with an existing H.323 environment. The H.225 gatekeeper-controlled trunk enables Cisco CallManager to communicate with Cisco CallManager clusters and other H.323 devices registered to the H.323 gatekeeper. The H.225 gatekeeper-controlled trunk is not recommended in a pure Cisco CallManager environment, but it is required in a mixed environment with Cisco CallManager and Cisco CallManager Express or another third-party H.323 gateway. The H.225 trunk attempts to discover the other H.323 device on a call-by-call basis. If it discovers a device that understands intercluster trunk protocol, it automatically uses that protocol. If it cannot discover the other device, Cisco CallManager uses the standard H.225 protocol. To use this method, choose Device > Trunk and choose H.225 Trunk (Gatekeeper Controlled).

questions.question_text: The corporate WAN has been extended to two newly acquired sites and it includes gatekeeper support. Each site has a Cisco CallManager and an H.323 gateway that allows connection to the PSTN. Which connection method is best for these two new customers?

choices.D: Configure a route pattern to a gateway in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.
choices.B: Configure CFUR in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.
choices.C: Configure a route pattern, a route list, and route groups to a trunk and a gateway in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.
choices.A: Configure AAR in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.

discussion.content: Gatekeeper CAC can not be used with AAR
The right answer is A - AAR

questions.question_text: Which action configures PSTN backup for calls that are rejected by the gatekeeper CAC?

questions.answer_description: Choose the number of significant digits to collect, from 0 to 32. Cisco Unified Communications Manager counts significant digits from the right (last digit) of the number that is called.

discussion.content:
Should be A. You need to specify the port under the dial-peer.
And E. The destination pattern on voip dial-peer should be 5015552001 not 2â€¦

choices.A: Add port 1/0:23 to dial-peer voice 123 pots.
choices.E: Change the destination-pattern on the dial-peer voice 23000 VoIP to 501501? and change the Significant Digits for inbound calls to 4.
choices.B: Ensure that the Significant Digits for inbound calls on the H.323 gateway configuration is 4.
choices.D: Add the command h323-gateway voip id on interface vlan120.
choices.C: Add a voice translation profile to truncate the number from 10 digits to 4 digits. Apply the voice translation profile to the Voice-port. The configuration field "Significant Digits for inbound calls" is left at default (All).

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

IT shows an H.323 gateway configuration in a Cisco Unified Communications Manager environment. An inbound PSTN call to this H.323 gateway fails to connect to IP phone extension 2001. The PSTN user hears a reorder tone. Debug isdn q931 on the H.323 gateway shows the correct called-party number as 5015552001.
Which two configuration changes can correct this issue? (Choose two.)

choices.D: GARP can be disabled at Cisco IP phones.
choices.C: GARP is normally used for HSRP.
choices.B: GARP can be used for a man-in-the-middle attack.
choices.A: GARP attacks require access to the target LAN or VLAN.

questions.answer_description: GARP (Gratuitous ARP) announce the presence of IP Phone on the network.
questions.question_text: Which statement is not true about GARP?

discussion.content: By default, Cisco Unified IP Phones accept Gratuitous ARP packets. Gratuitous ARP packets, which devices use, announce the presence of the device on the network. However, attackers can use these packets to spoof a valid network device; for example, an attacker could send out a packet that claims to be the default router. If you choose to do so, you can disable Gratuitous ARP in the Phone Configuration window.
